text: President John F. Kennedy opened the Seattle World's fair by telephone from Palm Beach, Florida. He pressed a gold telegraph key which focused an antenna at Andover, Maine and a Navy radio telescope station in Maryland on a star to pick up a 10,000 year-old radio signal. That in turn set in motion various exhibits at the fair.
Satellite Transit-5BN-3 failed to reach orbit after launch. It carried 2.1 pounds (0.95 kg) of radioactive plutonium from its SNAP RTG power source.
Tandy Corp. held a press conference in New York to announce its plans to build IBM PS/2 clones.
Nintendo released the original GameBoy in Japan. It sported the same controls as the NES and used black and gray pixels for the display.
